creator: alan_milligan@hotmail.com
text:
I cannot successfully untar this disto - it is incomplete:

gzip: stdin: unexpected end of file
tar: Unexpected EOF in archive
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now

The distro was retrieved from www.apache.org/dist (and two other mirrors I tried
all had the same file size - and same problem...).

This is a little surprising - surely I am not the first to download this release ...


Cheers, Alan

Please try untarring the distro without trying to decompress it; ie just tar xvf
httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz - this is actually a problem between mozilla and the server;
mozilla automatically decompresses gzipped files that are sent with
Content-Encoding x-gzip.
creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
alan_milligan@hotmail.com
text:
No!!

Although I have downloaded this distro with Mozilla, I normally use wget, and I
definitely have a compressed tar file:

[root@mistress bin]# file /home/downloads/httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz
/home/downloads/httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz: gzip compressed data, deflated, original
filename, `httpd-2.0.44.tar', last modified: Sat Jan 18 15:21:00 2003, max
compression, os: Unix

I am still concerned about the filesize - it's supposed to be 5376K but even
though my download always completes properly, my file size is:

[root@mistress bin]# ls -l /home/downloads/httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz
-rw-------    1 alan     alan      4685072 Mar 23 21:51
/home/downloads/httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz

creator: erik@codefaktor.de
text:
Just downloaded the httpd-2.0.44.tar.gz from apache.org/dist/httpd and two
randomly chosen mirrors (with Mozilla). No problems so far; I got a filesize of
5376K and also a correct md5 sum as well as a correct PGP signature. So, the
problem must be on your side of the network :-)

creator: thom@planetarytramp.net
text:
Yeah, I checked from my local mirror as well as nagoya and www.apache.org and
another mirror at random, all were fine with both mozilla and wget.
OK.  It now works for me too.  The wonders of indeterminism in computing ...
creator: alan_milligan@hotmail.com
